page.title: 18Coniston: Jobs & Schooling
page.content: {EMPLOYMENT:}Many people in this area derive all or part of their income from{tourism,}as hoteliers, guest house owners, shopkeepers, etc. Other main avenues of employment are: quarrying, jobs in shops & hotels, domestic services, the building trade, farming and local authority work. Some people{travel}to Ambleside or Ulverston and Barrow to work. A high proportion of people are {self-employed. {EDUCATION:}There are two schools in Coniston: the Church of England {Primary}School, and John Ruskin {Secondary}School. There is also a {Playgroup}for children over 3. There is no sixth form at John Ruskin, so pupils have to travel to Ulverston to take A Level courses. One family in the village teach their three primary age children at home.
